multiple-choice.question: Consider a square with sides of length 3. Assume this square contains 10 points. Which of the following is true?
multiple-choice.answer: At least two of these $n$ points are at distance at most $1$.
At least two of these $n$ points are at distance at most $\left. 1 \middle/ \sqrt{2} \right.$.
At least two of these $n$ points are at distance at most $\sqrt{2}$.
